info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 10 at 8:26PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches with higher elevations seeing up to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades from Highway 62 south to Howard Prairie, including Lake of the Woods on Highway 140 and Mt. Ashland. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although not in the advisory, 4 to 6 inches of snow is expected on Siskiyou Pass later tonight into Monday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
